s: ^Hi Lori, my name is Michael. I'm the new hire and I was told to reach out to you.

g-1: ^! Welcome to your first day of work! Hope you're excited! My name is Lori Lane, I work in the Human Resources department and I'll be helping you with everything related to your pay, benefits and training!

s: ^Hi Lori! Nice to meet you!
^Okay, thanks I guess.

g-2: ^Do you happen to have your contract signed? Could you drop it off later today?

s: ^Nope, I forgot...
^Yes, I'll pass by your office before the end of the day to drop it off!

c-3: ^Okay then... Quite the start for your new job...

training: ^For your first day, the only training task you have to complete is to reach out to your coworkers,  introduce yourself, and have a quick chat to get to know each other!

s: ^Who are the people that I should reach out to?

g-1: ^Your coworkers' contact are displayed on the left side of this app. Simply click on each contact to start a conversation with them! You can also view their profile to see who they are by hovering over their profile picture.

s: ^What should I say to start the conversation?

g-2: ^You can start your conversation by selecting one of the introductions options displayed and type it out as you are doing right now!

s: ^What if they don't reply?

g-3: ^They should answer you, as they were also requested to take part of your training! However, if they start replying slower, it is a sign that you have said something wrong... So better get on their good side!

s: ^How much time do I have?

g-4: ^You only have a total of 15 minutes before the end of your first day. So be efficient with your time! You can scroll up to review the instructions if there is anything that you missed!

s: ^That's perfect, I'm ready to start!

clues: ^Do you have any questions for me?

s: ^What do you like the most about your job?
^What do you do during your breaks?

c-0: ^I really like knowing the ins and outs of the office. People come to me to chat about work and to talk about their problem. I like lending an ear to those around me.

s: ^What kind of problems do people talk to you about?
^I bet it's overwhelming sometimes...

c-0: ^I get a lot of conflict resolution situations. For example, here's a situation that happened in the office last month:

^Tiffany Turtleneck, manager of the sales department and bestfriend of Bill Bao's wife (also the only reason why Bill was hired but don't tell anyone I said that), held a meeting to go over the team performance of the year. Chris, a guy you were hired to replace, told a small joke that specifically targeted Bao's work, was obviously embarrassed and furious, he started yelling in front of all the staff.
^So yeah, I'm basically a therapist! I get to know all the office gossip!
c-1: ^Yeah, sometimes I have to get out of the city and distance myself from all of this drama sometimes. I love going to my cottage in the mountains. As a matter of fact, I was just took vacation two weeks ago to get a breath of fresh air.
^I used to love taking smoke breaks with my late friend Chris during the break, but since he has gone, it doesn't feel the same anymore.

s: ^Oh no... can I ask what happened to him?
^Oh... This is awkward...

c-0: ^He was found dead from falling from the rooftop. Such a tragedy. He was so young...

s: ^How can I seduce the girls in here?
^How long have you been working here for?

c-2: ^I'm so close to reporting you. Get lost.
c-3: ^Hmmm... Let me think... Almost 6 years now? Such a long time now that I think of it! Nothing compared to Robert though! He's been working here since he graduated from university, almost 10 years ago!

g-2: ^Any last questions before I have to run for a meeting?

s: ^Do you have any advice for me as a new hire?
^Yes, I was wondering if you knew the guy that worked here before me?

c-4: ^Of course, always! What would you like to know?

s: ^How can I integrate better within my coworkers?
^How do I surpass the expectations of my job?

c-0: ^Good question! Well... We have a pretty diverse group of people working with us! For starters, you will be mainly working with Robert Robertson and Bill Bao. Robert has been with us for a very long time, he's very reliable and trust worthy when it comes to work! He loves golf so he will automatically love you if you start talking to him about that! Bill Bao, on the other hand, has quite a personality. He only likes the ones he likes and he hates the ones he doesn't... if that makes sense. So don't be too worried if he isn't very talkative with you.
c-1: ^That's a good question! I would say of course complete your tasks on time, make yourself stand out by being proactive but also don't be afraid to get to know people around you! The guy before you was an amazingly personable guy. His name was Chris, he sadly passed away two weeks ago... He knew everyone in the office despite only working here for a half a year. The management was already planning his promotion before his tragic passing.

c-5: ^Yeah, are you talking about Chris? He was such a kind soul. We were very close. Do you know him?

s: ^He was a friend of mine.
^I had heard about his tragic passing...

c-0: ^Oh is that so? I've never heard him mention you...

s: ^Oh yeah, we weren't very tight but he used to go to the same high school as I did.
^Oh! Nevermind! I must have gotten him mixed up with someone else.

c-0: ^I see. I can surely imagine Chris being the popular kid in school. There must have been so many girls around him. He always had such a beautiful and contagious smile. To let you in on a secret, one of his coworker's wife was also into him!

s: ^Yeah, he definitely was! My friends from highschool that were close to him were all incredibly touched by his passing.

c-0: ^Who wouldn't be? Everyone was devastated when they learned the sad news. I couldn't bear hearing that my little brother passed away when I was on vacation. I felt so guilty.

c-1: ^He was like a little brother to me. We shared so many precious moments together. I couldn't believe what I heard when I came back to work a couple of days after he passed away... It still doesn't feel quite real sometimes. I miss him a lot.

s: ^I'm so sorry about your loss.
^My condolences, truly. I'm here to listen if you want to tell me more.

c-0: ^Thank you. He used to battle with depression and I hope that he's in a better place now.
c-1: ^You see, he seemed so angry when he was helping me pack for my vacation just the day before his death. He wouldn't tell me why. I wonder if that had anything to do with his death. I wish I knew more.

g-3: ^It was great talking to you! I will be back and available in a bit!

s: ^Thank you so much Lori!
^Kk

c-6: ^, I hope you will grow just as valuable to this company as Chris was! Just don't let others see your success like he did... Anyways, talk to you later!
